intro: Pleocnemia chrysotricha, commonly known as the golden-haired pleocnemia, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit and the presence of yellowish, hairy structures on its stems. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are closely arranged and often have a distinct midrib, contributing to its overall appearance. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and ecological adaptations.
